info.title: XTM REST API
info.description:
# Introduction

XTM Cloud has SOAP and REST APIs that are public-facing.
The XTM functionality covered by the two APIs is different. This document describes the
REST API methods. You can find more information about the SOAP API at https://xtm.cloud/soap-api/.

The API methods described in this document mostly return HTTP code with body content in JSON format. When the response format is different,
it is clearly indicated in the description. Obligatory fields are marked as Required.

For support with the REST API, please visit https://xtm-cloud.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals.

REST API method responses include custom headers - `xtm-trace-id` and `xtm-span-id` -
which help track user requests throughout the XTM system. Including these headers in Support requests facilitates query analysis.

tags.name: Callback authentications
tags.description:
This section contains methods that relate to the authentication of callbacks.
Authentication type Descritpion
Basic Client provides a username and a password, XTM inserts them in the request header
  • Header key: Authorization
  • Header value: Basic Base64(username:password)
Signature Client provides a key and a secret, XTM inserts them in the request headers:
  • Header key: x-api-key
  • Header value: key
  • Header key: x-signature
  • Header value: SHA256(key + secret + x-timestamp) - this value is sent in UPPER CASE.
  • Header key: x-timestamp
  • Header value: real time in milliseconds, limited to 10 characters
OAuth 2.0 Client provides credentials to obtain OAuth 2.0 token:
  • URL to the authorization server (required)
  • client ID (required)
  • client secret (required)
  • username (required)
  • password (required)
  • scope
XTM sends request to the OAuth 2.0 authorization server with the Password grant type parameter. The OAuth 2.0 authorization server response must contain at least an access token and token type. Based on these fields, a value is created for the authorization header, which XTM inserts in the request:
  • Header key: Authorization
  • Header value: [token_type] [access_token]
If the access token is found to be expired when sending the callback, it is obtained from an OAuth 2.0 authorization server again and then callback is resent with a new token.

tags.name: Practice online
tags.description:
Try out the XTM REST API using a dedicated online tool that will help you create REST API requests correctly. All you have to do is enter the details from your existing XTM account in the required fields. The tool will send real requests that will be processed on your XTM account.

 [Click here to get started](https://api-examples.xtm-intl.com/)

tags.name: Definitions
tags.description:
**Project**: Processing one or more files from one source language to one or more target languages. **Job**: Process one file in the source language to transform it into one target language. **Step**: Workflows are composed of steps. The available default steps are: translate, correct, review, approve TM and LQA. **Bundle**: The source text segments can split into sections which are called bundles. Bundles can be allocated to different Linguists. **Task**: Processing a bundle in one step is a task.
Match typeDescription
iceMatchIn-context exact match, a 100% match with the same source text segment below and above
leveragedMatchLeveraged match, a 100% match
highFuzzyMatch95-99% fuzzy match
mediumFuzzyMatch85-94% fuzzy match
lowFuzzyMatch75-84% fuzzy match
machineTranslationA match obtained from a machine translation engine
repeats100% internal matches
highFuzzyRepeats95-99% internal fuzzy matches
mediumFuzzyRepeats85-94% internal fuzzy matches
lowFuzzyRepeats75-84% internal fuzzy matches
nonTranslatableSegments that only contain numerical or alphanumeric characters or punctuation

tags.name: HTTP Codes
tags.description:
**200** - OK

 The operation has been completed.

**201** - Created

 The request object has been created.

**202** - Accepted

 The request has been accepted for processing but the processing has not been completed.

**400** - Bad Request

 The request is invalid. You can find more details in the reason.

**401** - Unauthorized

 Authentication failed. This can be caused by an invalid or missing token or if access to the API has been disabled.

**403** - Forbidden

 This operation is forbidden for the service in general or at the time of the request. You can try again later.

**404** - Not Found

 The resource was not found.

**405** - Method Not Allowed

 This API operation is not supported. Send a valid request.

**406** - Not Acceptable

 The request is invalid. Specify valid request parameters.

**415** - Unsupported Media Type

 This request probably contains an incorrect header. In most cases, XTM returns responses in app/json.

**422** - Unprocessable Entity

 Specify values for all required parameter fields.

**500** - Internal Server Error

 Contact XTM support.

**503** - Service Unavailable

 The server temporarily cannot process the request. You can try again later.

tags.name: ISO-8601 Date format
tags.description:
**Date Format**

For all endpoints that require date information, our REST API accepts dates formatted in accordance with ISO-8601. This standard helps to avoid ambiguity and ensure that dates are understood regardless of the user's locale.

**ISO-8601 Overview**

ISO-8601 is an international standard for representing date and time values issued by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO). The standard is designed to provide a clear and unambiguous way to represent dates and times.

**Date and Time Formats**

- Full Date: YYYY-MM-DD

    - Example: 2023-03-31

- Date and Time in UTC: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ

    - Example: 2023-03-31T13:45:30Z

- Date and Time with Time Zone: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

    - Example: 2023-03-31T09:45:30-04:00

**Extended and Basic Formats**

ISO-8601 specifies two formats for representing date and time: extended and basic. Our API supports the extended format, which includes separators (e.g. hyphen - or colon :) for enhanced readability.

- Extended Format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ or YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

- Basic Format: YYYYMMDDThhmmssZ or YYYYMMDDThhmmss±hhmm (Not supported by our API)

**Additional Time Information**

While not all endpoints might require such precision, ISO-8601 allows for additional time information such as fractional seconds:

- Date and Time with Fractional Seconds: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ

    - Example: 2023-03-31T13:45:30.123Z

Please ensure that all date and time information is provided in ISO-8601 format to guarantee compatibility with our system.

tags.name: Cost generation error types
tags.description: NO_RATE_CARD - No rate card matches the language and subject matter. NO_RATE_CARD_STEP - Rate card values are missing for some steps. MANY_RATE_CARDS - User has many rate cards assigned. NO_CURRENCY_EXCHANGE - No currency exchange has been found to convert the user's billing currency. BILLING_CURRENCY_UNDEFINED - System billing currency has not been defined. NO_METRICS_OR_STATISTICS - Can't obtain metrics or statistics for project. PROJECT_NOT_ANALYSED - Can't analyze the project. NOTHING_CALCULATED - An unexpected error occurred. Contact XTM Support Team: support@xtm-intl.com NO_SUBJECT_MATTER_DEFINED_FOR_CLIENT - Can't generate costs: project subject matter is not in the list of subject matters defined in the system. Contact your Administrator. MULTIPLE_RATE_CARDS_PER_USER - Either user has many rate cards defined or no rate card has been defined for the user. DIFFERENT_VALUES_FOR_CORRECT_STEP - User's rate card values for matches in Correct workflow step differ. VALUES_FOR_MATCHES_NOT_ZERO - User's rate card values for ICE, leveraged, repetitions or non-translatable matches are not set to zero. DIFFERENT_FUZZY_MATCHES_VALUES - User's rate card values for fuzzy matches and fuzzy repeat matches differ.

tags.name: Cost generation warning types
tags.description: NO_RATE_CARD - No rate card is available, but it is not required for calculation. NO_RATE_CARD_STEP - No rate card is available for this step, but it is not required for calculation. USER_GROUP_ASSIGNED_TO_WORKFLOW_STEP - A workflow step has a group of users assigned, so the project costs cannot be calculated. NO_RATE_CARD_STEP_FOR_TIME - Time tracking is enabled, but the rate card values for time tracking are missing. NO_TIME_ENTERED - Manual time tracking is enabled, but the user has failed to enter the time they spent working. USER_NOT_A_LINGUIST - User is not a Linguist, so no rate card is available. JOB_UNASSIGNED - Job has not been assigned. NO_STATISTICS_FOR_LANGUAGES - Can't obtain statistics for many languages in project. NO_STATISTICS_FOR_LANGUAGE - Can't obtain statistics for a given language in project.

tags.name: OAuth 2.0
tags.description:
## Password flow (Resource Owner Password Credentials) ## This is the one of the simplest OAuth 2.0 authorization flows, suitable for integrations used by single user accounts. User credentials are stored in the client application instead of redirecting users to the XTM website. In this approach you need to take three steps: 1. Register To register a client application in XTM, contact the Support Team (support@xtm-intl.com). You will get your Client ID and Client Secret required to communicate with XTM REST API using the OAuth 2.0 standard. 2. Get your access token In the Password grant type, the client application makes a POST request to the server to exchange their username and password for an access token. The POST request looks like this: POST authentication-api/oauth/token HTTP/1.1 Authorization: Basic Base64(CLIENT_ID:CLIENT_SECRET) grant_type=password &username=CLIENTNAME:USERNAME &password=PASSWORD Headers:
  • Authorization – The request must contain the following header: "Authorization: Basic XXXXX", where XXXXX stands for the Client ID:Client Secret encoded in Base64.
Other parameters:
  • username (required) – XTM requires that a client name should be provided in the username or user_id fields in the following format: CLIENTNAME:USERNAME
  • user_id (required) – XTM requires that a client name should be provided in the username or user_id fields in the following format: CLIENTNAME:USER_ID
  • password (required) – user password
  • language (optional) – language code; see API resources for full list of available language codes.
A response contains two kinds of tokens:
  • access token – should be used by the client application in each call to XTM REST API; it is compliant with the JWT standard and has an expiration time expressed in seconds
  • refresh token – may be used to obtain a new access token (grant_type=refresh_token?refresh_token=REFRESH_TOKEN)
3. Apply the access token Access tokens should be added to each call made to the XTM REST API using the following method:
  • as an Authorization header:
    • POST /project-manager-api-rest/system Authorization: Bearer ACCESS_TOKEN ## Refresh Token flow ## Allows to obtain a new access token based on a valid refresh token. The POST request looks like this: POST authentication-api/oauth/token HTTP/1.1 Authorization: Basic Base64(CLIENT_ID:CLIENT_SECRET) grant_type=refresh_token &refresh_token=REFRESH_TOKEN

tags.name: SAML
tags.description:
A popular authentication standard using a third-party identity provider. You can use a third-party system to authenticate and then get an OAuth 2.0 token, which you can use in our oauth flow available here: [link to OAuth 2.0 section](#tag/OAuth-2.0). 1. Register To register a client application in XTM, contact the Support Team (support@xtm-intl.com). You will get a list of required data to setup the connection with your Identity Provider. 2. Get your access token You need to send a POST request to initiate the authentication process. The POST request looks like this: POST authentication-api/saml HTTP/1.1 client=CLIENT_NAME Headers:
  • Content-Type = multipart/form-data
A response should contain Location header and 301 HTTP Status code. To move on with the process, you need to follow the redirection URL. After following the URL, you will need to authenticate in the Identity Provider. After doing it correctly, Identity Provider will redirect you back to XTM. Then, XTM will check your authentication status and return accessToken and expireIn fields in a JSON format. Possible exceptions: {"message":"Client does not have external login service configured."} - When the IDP connection is not configured for the client. {"message":"Could not match SAML user with XTM user."} - When the authentication in IDP was successfull, but XTM was not able to match the user with any of users existing in XTM. {"message":"SAML User not authenticated for client %s, samlLoginResponseTO: %s"} - When the IDP authentication failed, contains your client name and data from IDP. {"message":"Client not provided."} - When client field has not been provided.

tags.name: Callbacks
tags.description:
Callbacks are sent to a previously defined URL. URLs can be passed in a Create Project request or defined as permanent URLs in our XML configuration (to do the latter, feel free to contact our support team support@xtm-intl.com). XTM tries to send a callback three times: with a 5000 ms timeout for responses and a 60000 ms timeout between consecutive failed attempts. However, the XTM Support Team can create custom callbacks and specify the timeout, the number of attempts or the intervals between consecutive attempts. If a protocol is missing, "https" will be added.

 **analysisFinishedCallback** - specifies a link to a call when project analysis is finished. The callback is sent as a POST request with an application/x-www-urlencoded content type and an 'additionalData' field in the request payload containing a JSON body ([open example](https://xtm.cloud/api-examples/analysis-finished-callback.txt)). XTM adds three request parameters to the URL, namely: xtmCustomerId, xtmProjectId and xtmUuid, for instance URL https://some.site/analysis/534-d345f-034r34r?xtmCustomerId=123&xtmProjectId=321&xtmUuid=1a2b584e-8b81-4319-a90f-196f54ea1717

 **workflowTransitionCallback** - specifies a link to a call in the event of any transition in active workflow steps. The callback is sent as a POST request with an application/x-www-urlencoded content type and an 'additionalData' field in the request payload containing a JSON body ([open example](https://xtm.cloud/api-examples/workflow-transition-callback.txt)). In this callback the sequence of sending is irrelevant, so it can be sent either before or after jobFinishedCallback or projectFinishedCallback. XTM adds three request parameters to the URL, namely: xtmCustomerId, xtmProjectId and xtmUuid, for instance URL https://some.site/workflow/534-d345f-034r34r?xtmCustomerId=123&xtmProjectId=321&xtmUuid=1a2b584e-8b81-4319-a90f-196f54ea1717

 **jobFinishedCallback** - specifies a link to a call when processing of one file in a single language combination is finished for the entire project. The callback is sent as a GET request. XTM adds four request parameters to the URL, namely: xtmCustomerId, xtmJobId, xtmProjectId and xtmUuid, for instance URL https://some.site/jobs/534-d345f-034r34r?xtmCustomerId=123&xtmJobId=222&xtmProjectId=321&xtmUuid=1a2b584e-8b81-4319-a90f-196f54ea1717

 **projectCreatedCallback** - specifies a link to a call when the project is created. The callback is sent as a POST request with an application/json content type and empty JSON as a payload. XTM adds two request parameters to the URL, namely: xtmProjectId and xtmUuid, for instance URL https://some.site/project/534-d345f-034r34r?xtmProjectId=321&xtmUuid=1a2b584e-8b81-4319-a90f-196f54ea1717

 **projectAcceptedCallback** - specifies a link to a call when the entire project is accepted. The callback is sent as a POST request with an application/json content type and empty JSON as a payload. XTM adds three request parameters to the URL, namely: xtmProjectId, xtmExternalProjectId and xtmUuid, for instance URL https://some.site/project/534-d345f-034r34r?xtmProjectExternalId=123&xtmProjectId=321&xtmUuid=1a2b584e-8b81-4319-a90f-196f54ea1717

 **projectFinishedCallback** - specifies a link to a call when the entire project is finished. The callback is sent as a GET request. XTM adds three request parameters to the URL, namely: xtmCustomerId, xtmProjectId and xtmUuid, for instance URL https://some.site/project/534-d345f-034r34r?xtmCustomerId=123&xtmProjectId=321&xtmUuid=1a2b584e-8b81-4319-a90f-196f54ea1717

 **invoiceStatusChangedCallback** - specifies a link to a call when the invoice changed has changed for any project. The callback is sent as a POST request with an application/json content type and empty JSON as a payload. XTM adds three request parameters to the URL, namely: xtmProjectId, xtmInvoiceStatus and xtmUuid, for instance URL https://some.site/project/534-d345f-034r34r?xtmProjectId=123&xtmInvoiceStatus=NOT_APPROVED&xtmUuid=1a2b584e-8b81-4319-a90f-196f54ea1717

 **sourceFileUpdatedCallback** - specifies a link to a call in the event of any change in the source files. The callback is sent as a POST request with an application/json content type and the payload containing a JSON body ([open example](https://xtm.cloud/api-examples/source-file-updated-callback.txt)). XTM adds two request parameters to the URL, namely: xtmProjectId and xtmUuid, for instance URL https://some.site/source-file/534-d345f-034r34r?xtmProjectId=321&xtmUuid=1a2b584e-8b81-4319-a90f-196f54ea1717

 **projectActivityChangedCallback** - specifies a link to a call when the activity of any project is changed. The callback is sent as a POST request with an application/json content type and the payload containing a JSON body ([open example](https://xtm.cloud/api-examples/project-activity-changed-callback.txt)). XTM adds two request parameters to the URL, namely: xtmProjectId and xtmUuid, for instance URL https://some.site/project/534-d345f-034r34r?xtmProjectId=321&xtmUuid=1a2b584e-8b81-4319-a90f-196f54ea1717

 **projectLanguageChangedCallback** - specifies a link to a call when a language of any project is whether deleted or added. The callback is sent as a POST request with an application/json content type and the payload containing a JSON body ([open example](https://xtm.cloud/api-examples/project-language-changed-callback.txt)). XTM adds two request parameters to the URL, namely: xtmProjectId and xtmUuid, for instance URL https://some.site/project/534-d345f-034r34r?xtmProjectId=321&xtmUuid=1a2b584e-8b81-4319-a90f-196f54ea1717

 **dueDateChangedCallback** - specifies a link to a call when due dates for jobs, workflow steps, target languages or the entire project are updated. The callback is sent as a POST request, content type application/json, with a payload that contains a JSON body ([open example](https://xtm.cloud/api-examples/due-date-changed-callback.txt)). If the project dates are modified, their values are reflected in these fields: newSourceDueDate, workflowStartDueDate, workflowDueDate and projectDueDate. The types of changes are reported in the changedProjectDueDates field. If project dates are removed, information about the changes are only shown in the 'changedProjectDueDates' field. XTM Cloud adds two request parameters to the URL: xtmProjectId and xtmUuid, Example URL https://some.site/project/534-d345f-034r34r?xtmProjectId=321&xtmUuid=1a2b584e-8b81-4319-a90f-196f54ea1717

Callbacks support authentication. XTM provides three types of authentication, see [API resources](#tag/Callback-authentications) for details.

get.description:
This method downloads project files which can include files for offline translation, target files, PDF previews, different kinds of Excel reports and LQA results.

The following types of files can be downloaded with the PROJECT value of the fileScope parameter: TIPP, LQA_REPORT, LQA_EXTENDED_TABLE_REPORT, MULTI_EXCEL.

In order to download any other type of file, the fileScope parameter must be set to JOB. In such case, PROJECT fileScope value specifies that a single file will be downloaded, whereas JOB fileScope value specifies that there will be multiple files, one for each job covered by the request.

When files generated for the entire project are requested for download, then the responses do not include job IDs.

Parameters fileNameFilter and fileNameFilterType work only when fileScope "JOB" is used.

The response is generated in the application/octet-stream format as a ZIP file.

User with Linguist role can download only files of types XLIFF, XLIFF_NTP to which he is assigned to in the active projects. For Linguist role, jobIds is required parameter and fileScope JOB has to be used.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The request header must contain one of these Authorization types: "Authorization: XTM-Basic XXXXX", where “XXXXX“ stands for your token. If you do not have a token, obtain it using the [authentication method.](#tag/XTM-Basic) "Authorization: Bearer XXXXX", where “XXXXX“ stands for your OAuth 2.0 token. For details about OAuth tokens, see [the OAuth 2.0 section.](#tag/OAuth-2.0)

parameters.name: fetchTargetFileTypes
parameters.description: Option only for fileType = TARGET and fileScope = JOB. It allows to include empty, non-analysable and not-supported file types in the download, they are not included by default

parameters.name: fileIds
parameters.description: File IDs.

parameters.name: fileNameFilter
parameters.description: File name filter.

parameters.name: fileNameFilterType
parameters.description:
Type of file name's filter.

When "CONTAINS" is used, the file name has to contain provided value.

When "EQUALS" is used, the file name has to be equal to provided value.

When "STARTS_WITH" is used, the file name has to start with provided value.

When "ENDS_WITH" is used, the file name has to end with provided value.

In case of uploading a ZIP file as a source, folders structure has to be respected.

Example: For a file "example.txt" in a folder example, the file name is example/example.txt.

put.description: This method updates due dates for jobs, workflow steps, target languages or the entire project. If any of the due dates to be set is in the wrong format, the request will not be executed. When a new due date is not specified for a job/workflow step/target language, the existing due date will be reset, resulting in no due date set for the objects. When projectDueDate is empty in the request, the due date of the project will not be changed.

post.description:
Create multiple projects in one go using this method. Requests must include:
  • customerId
  • name
  • translation files.
A valid project creation request must either include either
  • workflowId
  • templateId of an existing template that specifies a workflow definition.
Every translation file must either:
  • contain source and target languages
  • use the following pattern for all file names
source-language_target-language_rest-file-name Example en-GB_pl-PL_de-DE_file1.xml, de-DE_en-GB_file2.xml Content in the request body must be multipart/form-data.

post.description:
Generates project files. Files can be generated for the whole project or a specified scope.

Files that can be generated for the entire project or language include:  TIPP, LQA_REPORT, LQA_EXTENDED_TABLE_REPORT, MULTI_EXCEL, PDF, PDF_COLOURED_BY_MATCH_RATE, PDF_COLOURED_BY_XLIFF_DOC_STATUS, EXCEL_EXTENDED_TABLE, PDF_EXTENDED_TABLE, HTML_EXTENDED_TABLE.

The targetLanguage parameter only specifies the following files generated per one project: TIPP, LQA_REPORT, MULTI_EXCEL, PDF, PDF_COLOURED_BY_MATCH_RATE, PDF_COLOURED_BY_XLIFF_DOC_STATUS. It is not used to generate joblds-based files.

When files are generated for a specific scope, then the jobIds parameter must be used. In such case, any type of file listed under fileTypes values can be generated with the exception of MULTI_EXCEL.

Generated files can be identified by their unique IDs.

User with Linguist role can generate only files of types XLIFF, XLIFF_NTP to which he is assigned to in the active projects.

get.description:
This method downloads the source files for project or specific jobs.

The response is generated in the application/octet-stream format as a ZIP file.

parameters.name: jobIds
parameters.description: Job IDs.

parameters.name: folderStructure
parameters.description:
Folder structure in which source files are downloaded.

FLAT: flat file structure. All files are downloaded in the same folder. To distinguish between files with the same name, different suffixes are added to them. Example: If two files are both called test.txt, they are called test(file_id_1).txt and test(file_id_2).txt.

ORIGINAL: the file structure present in the original source ZIP file is recreated and the download files are placed in folders with the same names as before.

post.description:
This method starts the project reanalysis.

Reanalysis can cause changes to the project:

  • Metrics and TM matching will be recalculated.
  • Target segment comments added in XTM Workbench will be deleted.
  • Workflow allocations will remain unchanged.
  • Statistics will remain unchanged if the “Project is reanalysed” option is selected in Configuration > Data > Estimates > Cost settings > Automation of continuous projects.
  • Any generated offline files will be deleted from the History.
  • If machine translation has been enabled for the project, all segments that qualify for it will be resent to the MT engine.

get.description: This method returns statistics for a single or multiple target languages. Project statistics list all the different types of matches processed by users in jobs divided by workflow steps. The method returns source and target statistics. Source statics are calculated as the number of words or characters processed compared to the source text. Target statics represent the number of the resultant words or characters. See [API resources](#tag/Definitions) for description of match types.

get.description:
This method returns the status of a specified project. There are four levels of response: project, jobs and workflow steps.

When the fetchLevel parameter is not set, only the project status is returned.

When the fetchLevel parameter is set to **JOBS**, the project status is returned together with individual statuses for all jobs.

When the fetchLevel parameter is set to **STEPS**, the project status is returned together with individual statuses for all jobs and their active workflow steps.

When the fetchLevel parameter is set to **BUNDLES**, the project status is returned together with individual statuses for all jobs, their active workflow steps and bundles.

post.summary: Move jobs to next workflow step
post.description:
This method finishes active workflow steps and moves jobs to the next step. This happens regardless of whether the jobs are all in the same step or different workflow steps.

When job Ids are specified, only the specified jobs are moved forward. When job Ids are not specified, all jobs are moved forward in the workflow.

selectionType.description:
Specify which additional customer resources should be used: terminology, translation memory, or both.
If you select one of the “ALL” options, the “ids” field values are not considered and all customers to whom the relevant PM has access are selected automatically.
If you select one of the “SELECTED” options, enter their IDs in the “ids” field.
Default customer’s ID is always provided for both terminology and translation memory.

name.description:
Name
Project name cannot contain any of the following characters: , /, :, *, ?, ", <, >, |, {, }, [TAB].

segmentLockingType.description:
DISABLED - disables this option
ANY_100_MATCH - segments with approved and not approved leveraged or ICE matches will be locked
APPROVED_100_MATCH - segments with approved leveraged or ICE matches will be locked
XLIFFDOC_TRANSLATED, XLIFFDOC_PROOFED, XLIFFDOC_VALIDATED - segments with a specific xliff:doc status will be locked

completionStatus.description:
Completion status of job.

IN_PROGRESS - job is active in the workflow.

FINISHED - job has been completed in all steps of the workflow.

CANCELLED - job is cancelled in the project.

DELETED - job is deleted from the project.

ERROR - error is returned for job status when none of the statuses above applies.

IN_PROGRESS - workflow has not been completed for any job in the project.

FINISHED - workflow has been completed for all jobs in the project.

xtm-basic.name: Authorization

bearer-token-oauth2.description:
OAuth 2.0 – a commonly used standard among the vast majority of API providers working in cloud applications. XTM supports the Password flow (Resource Owner Password Credentials) and the Refresh token flow to obtain access tokens. This method is preferred by XTM

You can find more information about OAuth tokens here: [link to OAuth 2.0 section](#tag/OAuth-2.0).

Roles.description:
Access to the various methods in the XTM REST API is controlled by the login credentials. More details under [Roles section.](#tag/Roles)
Roles
  • administrator - Administrator. Equivalent of ADMINISTRATOR in Roles)
  • pm - Internal Project manager. Equivalent of PROJECT_MANAGER in Roles)
  • customer_pm - Customer Project manager. Equivalent of CUSTOMER_PM in Roles)
  • linguist - Linguist. Equivalent of LINGUIST in Roles)
  • term_expert - Terminology expert. Equivalent of TERMINOLOGY_EXPERT in Roles)
  • tm_expert - Translation memory expert. Equivalent of TM_EXPERT in Roles)
